definitions.definition: ( transitive ) To make an impression on, by making a loud blast or din.
( intransitive ) To make a loud noise.
( transitive , informal ) To play (music) very loudly out of a speaker.
( transitive ) To shatter, as if by an explosion.
( transitive ) To open up a hole in, usually by means of a sudden and imprecise method (such as an explosion).
( transitive , science fiction ) To shoot, especially with an energy weapon (as opposed to one which fires projectiles).
examples: Chewbacca blasted the Stormtroopers with his laser rifle.

definitions.definition: ( soccer ) To shoot ; kick the ball in hope of scoring a goal.
( transitive , intransitive , slang , African-American Vernacular ) To shoot; to attack or shoot (someone or a place).
examples: That's when we decided to blast him.

definitions.definition: ( transitive ) To criticize or reprimand severely ; to verbally discipline or punish .
examples: My manager suddenly blasted me yesterday for being a little late to work for five days in a row, because I was never getting myself up on time.

definitions.definition: ( transitive ) To bring destruction or ruin on; to destroy .

examples: A cold wind blasted the rose plants.

definitions.definition: ( intransitive , obsolete ) To be blighted or withered.
examples: The bud blasted in the blossom.

definitions.definition: ( intransitive , obsolete ) To blow , for example on a trumpet .
( bodybuilding , slang ) To have a period of full dosage of PEDs as opposed to reducing them during a cruise period.

main_definition: ( transitive ) To make an impression on, by making a loud blast or din.

definitions.definition: To run a nucleotide sequence (for nucleic acids ) or an amino acid sequence (for proteins ) through a BLAST (Basic Local Alignment Search Tool).

main_definition: ( biology , informal , transitive ) To run a nucleotide sequence (for nucleic acids ) or an amino acid sequence (for proteins ) through a BLAST (Basic Local Alignment Search Tool).
